item.title: 4 locations in North Karnataka record over 39 degree, Kallur hobli hottest at 39.8 degree
item.description:
<![CDATA[Vijayapura: The North Karnataka region is experiencing a steady rise in temperatures, with Kallur hobli in Raichur district recording the highest maximum temperature of 39.8 degree celsius in the state over the past 24 hours, according to the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre (KSNDMC).
Several parts of Raichur and Vijayapura districts reported soaring temperatures, ranging between 39.1 degree and 39.8 degree. In Raichur district, three locations recorded temperatures exceeding ...]]>
item.author: Gururaj A Paniyadi, About The Author, Principal Correspondent With Deccan Chronicle, Specializes In Covering Coastal, North Karnataka Districts. His Expertise Lies In Political Analysis, He Holds A Profound Interest In Human Interest Stories, History, Culture. Offering Extensive Coverage, Gururaj Explores Various Facets, Including Politics
